com.netflix.nicobar.core.utils

Class ClassPathUtils

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.netflix.nicobar.core.utils.ClassPathUtils

  • public class ClassPathUtils
extends java.lang.Object
    Utility methods for dealing with classes and resources in a ClassLoader

    • Method Detail

      • getJdkPaths

        public static java.util.Set<java.lang.String> getJdkPaths()
        Get a list of JDK packages in the classpath, by scanning the bootstrap classpath.
        Returns:
        a set of package path strings (package paths separated by '/' and not '.').

      • findRootPathForResource

        @Nullable
public static java.nio.file.Path findRootPathForResource(java.lang.String resourceName,
                                                  java.lang.ClassLoader classLoader)
        Find the root path for the given resource. If the resource is found in a Jar file, then the result will be an absolute path to the jar file. If the resource is found in a directory, then the result will be the parent path of the given resource. For example, if the resourceName is given as "scripts/myscript.groovy", and the path to the file is "/root/sub1/script/myscript.groovy", then this method will return "/root/sub1"
        Parameters:
        resourceName - relative path of the resource to search for. E.G. "scripts/myscript.groovy"
        classLoader - the ClassLoader to search
        Returns:
        absolute path of the root of the resource.

      • findRootPathForClass

        @Nullable
public static java.nio.file.Path findRootPathForClass(java.lang.Class<?> clazz)
        Find the root path for the given class. If the class is found in a Jar file, then the result will be an absolute path to the jar file. If the resource is found in a directory, then the result will be the parent path of the given resource.
        Parameters:
        clazz - class to search for
        Returns:
        absolute path of the root of the resource.

      • getJarPathFromUrl

        public static java.nio.file.Path getJarPathFromUrl(java.net.URL jarUrl)
        Find the jar containing the given resource.
        Parameters:
        jarUrl - URL that came from a jar that needs to be parsed
        Returns:
        Path to the Jar containing the resource.

      • getDirectoriesFromJar

        public static java.util.Set<java.nio.file.Path> getDirectoriesFromJar(java.nio.file.Path pathToJarFile)
                                                               throws java.io.IOException
        Get all of the directory paths in a zip/jar file
        Parameters:
        pathToJarFile - location of the jarfile. can also be a zipfile
        Returns:
        set of directory paths relative to the root of the jar
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • classToResourceName

        public static java.lang.String classToResourceName(java.lang.Class<?> clazz)
        Get the resource name for the class file for the given class
        Parameters:
        clazz - the class to convert
        Returns:
        resource name appropriate for using with ClassLoader.getResource(String)

      • classNameToResourceName

        public static java.lang.String classNameToResourceName(java.lang.String className)
        Get the resource name for the class file for the given class name
        Parameters:
        className - fully qualified classname to convert
        Returns:
        resource name appropriate for using with ClassLoader.getResource(String)

      • scanClassPath

        public static java.util.Set<java.lang.String> scanClassPath(java.lang.String classPath,
                                            java.util.Set<java.lang.String> excludeJarSet)
        Scan the classpath string provided, and collect a set of package paths found in jars and classes on the path.
        Parameters:
        classPath - the classpath string
        excludeJarSet - a set of jars to exclude from scanning
        Returns:
        the results of the scan, as a set of package paths (separated by '/').

      • scanClassPath

        public static java.util.Set<java.lang.String> scanClassPath(java.lang.String classPath,
                                            java.util.Set<java.lang.String> excludeJarSet,
                                            java.util.Set<java.lang.String> excludePrefixes,
                                            java.util.Set<java.lang.String> includePrefixes)
        Scan the classpath string provided, and collect a set of package paths found in jars and classes on the path. On the resulting path set, first exclude those that match any exclude prefixes, and then include those that match a set of include prefixes.
        Parameters:
        classPath - the classpath string
        excludeJarSet - a set of jars to exclude from scanning
        excludePrefixes - a set of path prefixes that determine what is excluded
        includePrefixes - a set of path prefixes that determine what is included
        Returns:
        the results of the scan, as a set of package paths (separated by '/').

      • scanClassPathWithExcludes

        public static java.util.Set<java.lang.String> scanClassPathWithExcludes(java.lang.String classPath,
                                                        java.util.Set<java.lang.String> excludeJarSet,
                                                        java.util.Set<java.lang.String> excludePrefixes)
        Scan the classpath string provided, and collect a set of package paths found in jars and classes on the path, excluding any that match a set of exclude prefixes.
        Parameters:
        classPath - the classpath string
        excludeJarSet - a set of jars to exclude from scanning
        excludePrefixes - a set of path prefixes that determine what is excluded
        Returns:
        the results of the scan, as a set of package paths (separated by '/').

      • scanClassPathWithIncludes

        public static java.util.Set<java.lang.String> scanClassPathWithIncludes(java.lang.String classPath,
                                                        java.util.Set<java.lang.String> excludeJarSet,
                                                        java.util.Set<java.lang.String> includePrefixes)
        Scan the classpath string provided, and collect a set of package paths found in jars and classes on the path, including only those that match a set of include prefixes.
        Parameters:
        classPath - the classpath string
        excludeJarSet - a set of jars to exclude from scanning
        includePrefixes - a set of path prefixes that determine what is included
        Returns:
        the results of the scan, as a set of package paths (separated by '/').
